results.name: Number of integer solutions to the equation 4*x^2 + y^2 + 8*z^2 = n.
comment: Related to primitive congruent numbers A006991.
Assuming the Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture, the even number 2n is a congruent number if it is squarefree and a(n) = 2 A072071(n).
Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
reference: J. B. Tunnell, A classical Diophantine problem and modular forms of weight 3/2, Invent. Math., 72 (1983), 323-334.

formula: Expansion of phi(q) * phi(q^4) * phi(q^8) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 09 2012
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (32 t)) = 2^(7/2) (t/i)^(3/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A080917. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 23 2018
mathematica: maxN=128; soln3=Table[0, {maxN/2}]; xMax=Ceiling[Sqrt[maxN/8]]; yMax=Ceiling[Sqrt[maxN/2]]; zMax=Ceiling[Sqrt[maxN/16]]; Do[n=4x^2+y^2+8z^2; If[n>0&&n<=maxN/2, s=8; If[x==0, s=s/2]; If[y==0, s=s/2]; If[z==0, s=s/2]; soln3[[n]]+=s], {x, 0, xMax}, {y, 0, yMax}, {z, 0, zMax}]
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^4] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^8], {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jul 23 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^-2 * eta(x^2 + A)^5 * eta(x^4 + A)^-4 * eta(x^8 + A)^3 * eta(x^16 + A)^3 * eta(x^32 + A)^-2, n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Feb 11 2003 */
